de.cmlab.sensation.xmlrpc
Class GatewayXMLRPC

java.lang.Object
  de.cmlab.sensation.xmlrpc.GatewayXMLRPC
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.xmlrpc.AuthenticatedHandler
public class GatewayXMLRPC
extends Object
implements org.apache.xmlrpc.AuthenticatedHandler

GatewayXMLRPC
This class is used as a gateway for incoming and outgoing XMLRPC calls on/from the GatewayHandler. It acts as a buffer between the GatewayHandler and the XMLRCP clients and connects to the GatewayHandler for incoming calls and to the XMLRPCClientGUI or the midlet client for outgoing calls. It inhabits a security mechanism against too many calls within a short time and therefore relieves some work from the GatewayHandler.

NOTE: To completely switch off any security mechanism (->authenticate) for this class just comment the "implements AuthenticatedHandler" in the source code.

!THIS IS NOT RECOMMENDED BECAUSE OF SECURITY RISKS!

Version:
$Id: GatewayXMLRPC.java,v 1.54 2005/05/12 11:53:25 eglaldap Exp $
Author:
Tom Gross, Matthias Pfaff

Constructor Summary
GatewayXMLRPC()
          the constructor initializes the cache Hashtable and the client connection to the GatewayHandler
if the localgateway variable in the gatewayxmlrpc.properties file is set on 0, it establishes its own Webserver else the "GatewayXMLRPC" handle is added to the Webserver the GatewayHandler is creating.

Constructor Detail

GatewayXMLRPC

public GatewayXMLRPC()
the constructor initializes the cache Hashtable and the client connection to the GatewayHandler
if the localgateway variable in the gatewayxmlrpc.properties file is set on 0, it establishes its own Webserver else the "GatewayXMLRPC" handle is added to the Webserver the GatewayHandler is creating.
If authenticate in the properties is set to 1 (is enabled) then is checked if the database is working. If not, authentication is disabled

getValueHashtable

public Hashtable getValueHashtable(String sensorID)
Returns a Hashtable of a sensor value

Parameters:
sensorID - The sensor ID the value request is for
Returns:
Hashtable containing sensor value the keys range from "0" to "2" where "0" is the value as String, "1" is a Date containing the time of creation of the value, and "2" is the id of the sensor that gernerated the value

getHardwareMetadata

public Vector getHardwareMetadata(String hardwareID)
method for aquiring the hardware metadata

Parameters:
hardwareID - String containing the id of a hardware item
Returns:
a Vector containing the hardware metadata as String Vector items from 0 to 7 the time since the hardware is available (Date) the time until the hardware is available (Date) the description of the hardware (String) the comment of the initializer (String) the location id of the sensor (String) the owner (String) the sensorML XML (String) the XML description XML (String)

authenticate

public boolean authenticate(String user,
                            String pw)
this method is automatically used if the setBasicAuthentication(name, password) is used in the XmlRpcClient instance. This function authenticates the user for the methods of this class. Therefore, the name and the password are checked. Because the name and password are checked every time a method is used, the client parameters are also saved in a local Hashtable, which is asked from that point on for authentication. NOTE: !This method only functions with xmlrpc v 1.1. and the authentication patch.!

Specified by:
authenticate in interface org.apache.xmlrpc.AuthenticatedHandler

main

public static void main(String[] args)
